Description: A rectangular fragment of ivory: with the figure of a scorpion in relief on one side. The fragment probably comes from the side of a vase, as it has a slight curvature.
Curator's comments: See J. E. Quibell & F. W. Green, 'Hierakonpolis' I (London, 1989), pl. XII; B. Adams, 'Ancient Hierakonpolis' (Warminster, 1974), pl. 45 [364]. Bibliography: A. Roveri and F. Tiradritte [eds.], 'Kemet: Alle Sorgenti del Tempo' (Ravenna, 1998), p.233 [198].
Acquisition name: Purchased from: R J Moss & Co
